html:
Ethical Hacking

One tool in the arsenal of the defenders of computing infrastructures is hacking! In the same way that we regularly conduct tests of safety critical systems, a company should conduct regular tests of its infrastructure in order to ensure that the deployed countermeasures are appropriate and that the information security policies are indeed being adhered to. This module will provide the students with the necessary technical and theoretical foundation knowledge that one needs in order to conduct a full-scale penetration test.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Explain and critically discuss the ethical issues relating to the performance of penetration testing. [Knowledge and understanding, learning]

+  Explain and analyse the stages required by an ethical hacker to successfully compromise a target. [Analysis, problem solving, application]

+  Critically evaluate security techniques used to protect systems and user data. [Analysis, problem solving]

+  Demonstrate a critical knowledge of the tools, methods and procedures used within the network security arena. [Knowledge and understanding, reflection]

+  Communicate effectively the results of penetration testing. [Communication]

Module Content:
